actor_awards.notes: While Merrill himself did not win individual competitive acting awards, he starred in 'All About Eve', which won the Academy Award for Best Picture.

filmography.title: All About Eve
filmography.role_description: The talented and charismatic Broadway director who is the devoted lover of Margo Channing and becomes a target of Eve Harrington's manipulation.
filmography.plot: An ingenue insinuates herself into the company of an established but aging stage actress and her circle of theater friends.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Picture (Film won 6 Oscars); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#16)

filmography.title: Another Man's Poison
filmography.role_description: A fugitive bank robber who stumbles upon a murder scene and blackmails the killer (Bette Davis) into letting him pose as her deceased husband.
filmography.plot: A successful mystery novelist kills her estranged husband, but her plan to dispose of the body is complicated when a criminal on the run arrives at her isolated house.

filmography.title: Twelve O'Clock High
filmography.role_description: The compassionate commander of a bomber group who is relieved of duty for becoming too emotionally attached to his men, serving as a foil to the tough General Savage.
filmography.plot: A hard-as-nails general takes over a B-17 bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Dean Jagger); National Film Registry: Inducted (1998)

filmography.title: The Human Jungle
filmography.role_description: A tough police captain who takes over a crime-ridden precinct and fights to clean up the streets despite internal and external pressure.
filmography.plot: A police captain is assigned to clean up a district overrun by gangsters and juvenile delinquents.

filmography.title: Mysterious Island
filmography.role_description: A cynical war correspondent and balloonist who escapes a Civil War prison with a group of soldiers and becomes stranded on a monster-filled island.
filmography.plot: During the Civil War, a group of Union soldiers and two Confederates escape in a balloon and crash land on a strange Pacific island inhabited by giant creatures.

filmography.title: Where the Sidewalk Ends
filmography.role_description: A ruthless mob boss who becomes the prime suspect in a murder investigation led by a detective with a violent streak.
filmography.plot: A police detective who accidentally kills a suspect tries to pin the crime on a gang leader while falling in love with the suspect's widow.

filmography.title: Phone Call from a Stranger
filmography.role_description: An attorney who survives a plane crash and decides to visit the families of the three passengers he met on the flight to deliver their final messages.
filmography.plot: After surviving a plane crash, a man visits the families of three fellow passengers who died, helping them resolve their personal problems.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Nominated – Golden Lion

filmography.title: Decision Before Dawn
filmography.role_description: An American intelligence officer who recruits German prisoners of war to return to Nazi Germany as spies for the Allies.
filmography.plot: During the final days of World War II, the US Army uses German POWs to spy on their own country to shorten the war.

filmography.title: Witness to Murder
filmography.role_description: A police detective who investigates a woman's claim that she saw a murder, initially doubting her but eventually fighting to save her.
filmography.plot: A woman witnesses a murder from her window, but the police can't find the body and the killer tries to drive her insane.

filmography.title: The Great Impostor
filmography.role_description: The father of the protagonist Ferdinand Waldo Demara, whose own failures influence his son's life of deception.
filmography.plot: The true story of a brilliant young man who successfully impersonated a marine, a monk, a surgeon, and a prison warden.

filmography.title: Clambake
filmography.role_description: A wealthy oil tycoon and father of the protagonist (Elvis Presley), who bets his son that he can't survive without his family fortune.
filmography.plot: The heir to an oil fortune trades places with a water-ski instructor to see if he can find a girl who will love him for himself, not his money.

filmography.title: A Blueprint for Murder
filmography.role_description: The lawyer brother of the protagonist who helps investigate the suspicious death of his niece.
filmography.plot: A man suspects his sister-in-law of poisoning his brother and niece for their inheritance and races to save his nephew.

filmography.title: Slattery's Hurricane
filmography.role_description: A Navy commander and romantic rival to the protagonist, a storm-chasing pilot.
filmography.plot: A former Navy pilot, now a weather flyer, reflects on his life while flying into the eye of a hurricane.

filmography.title: The Frogmen
filmography.role_description: The tough leader of an Underwater Demolition Team (UDT) during World War II who must earn the respect of his new commander.
filmography.plot: The story of the Underwater Demolition Teams (precursors to the Navy SEALs) and their dangerous missions in the Pacific during WWII.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Original Story

filmography.title: Winged Victory
filmography.role_description: An Air Force captain in this wartime drama about the training of pilot recruits.
filmography.plot: A group of recruits from different backgrounds join the US Army Air Forces and go through training to become pilots.

filmography.title: The Pleasure of His Company
filmography.role_description: The solid, dependable second husband of a woman whose charming but irresponsible ex-husband returns for their daughter's wedding.
filmography.plot: A playboy father returns home for his daughter's wedding and tries to disrupt the proceedings and win back his ex-wife.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Fred Astaire (Best Actor)

filmography.title: Destination Inner Space
filmography.role_description: The director of an underwater laboratory who must deal with the discovery of an alien spacecraft and a creature on the loose.
filmography.plot: Scientists in an underwater lab encounter a UFO and a dangerous amphibian monster.

filmography.title: Around the World Under the Sea
filmography.role_description: An expert scientist on a submarine crew tasked with planting sensors on the ocean floor to predict earthquakes.
filmography.plot: A team of scientists travels the globe in a sophisticated submarine to install earthquake warning sensors.

filmography.title: The Power
filmography.role_description: A policeman involved in the investigation of a series of mysterious deaths caused by a person with telekinetic powers.
filmography.plot: A scientist tries to identify a person with superhuman mental abilities who is killing off members of a research team.

filmography.title: The Last Challenge
filmography.role_description: A town character who interacts with a young gunslinger seeking to challenge the marshal.
filmography.plot: A young gunslinger arrives in town to challenge the marshal, a former gunfighter, to a duel.

filmography.title: Earth II
filmography.role_description: A key figure in a space station colony that declares itself an independent nation.
filmography.plot: A colony on a space station faces a crisis when a Chinese nuclear weapon is placed in orbit nearby.

filmography.title: The Black Dakotas
filmography.role_description: A ruthless Confederate spy who impersonates a government agent to steal gold and incite a Sioux uprising.
filmography.plot: During the Civil War, a Confederate agent tries to steal gold meant for the Sioux Indians to fund the war effort.

filmography.title: Night Without Sleep
filmography.role_description: A troubled composer who wakes up with a hangover and a suspicion that he may have committed a murder during a blackout.
filmography.plot: A man tries to reconstruct the events of a drunken night to determine if he killed his wife.

filmography.title: The Wonderful Country
filmography.role_description: An Army major commanding a unit of Buffalo Soldiers who seeks help to track Apaches in Mexico.
filmography.plot: An American expatriate working for a Mexican warlord is sent to buy guns in Texas, where he breaks his leg and reconnects with his past.

filmography.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
filmography.role_description: A character involved in the violent tale of a buffalo hunter seeking revenge on the men who branded him.
filmography.plot: A buffalo hunter returns home with a fortune, only to be robbed and branded by three men, leading him on a quest for vengeance.

filmography.title: The Savage Eye
filmography.role_description: The voice of the protagonist's conscience or 'angel', providing commentary on her journey through the underbelly of Los Angeles.
filmography.plot: A dramatized documentary following a divorced woman's descent into loneliness and despair in Los Angeles.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Robert J. Flaherty Award (Best Documentary)
